net.jordaria.item

Enum Quality

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Quality>
      • net.jordaria.item.Quality
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Quality>

    public enum Quality
extends java.lang.Enum<Quality>
    An enum of qualities for items. Each quality contains stat chances, item text colors, and names of the quality.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

        public static Quality[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Quality c : Quality.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:

      • valueOf

        public static Quality valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:

      • getFirstTypeChance

        public float getFirstTypeChance()
        Returns the chance of having an elemental damage/protection. This is a float value from 0.0 to 1.0, with 1.0 as a 100% chance of having at least one element.
        Returns:
        The chance of having the first elemental type

      • getSecondTypeChance

        public float getSecondTypeChance()
        Returns the chance of having a second elemental damage/protection. This is a float value from 0.0 to 1.0, with 1.0 as a 100% chance of having a second element.
        Returns:
        The chance of having the second elemental type

      • getThirdTypeChance

        public float getThirdTypeChance()
        Returns the chance of having a third elemental damage/protection. This is a float value from 0.0 to 1.0, with 1.0 as a 100% chance of having a second element.
        Returns:
        The chance of having the third elemental type

      • getFourthTypeChance

        public float getFourthTypeChance()
        Returns the chance of having a fourth elemental damage/protection. This is a float value from 0.0 to 1.0, with 1.0 as a 100% chance of having a second element.
        Returns:
        The chance of having the fourth elemental type

      • getNormalPower

        public int getNormalPower()
        Returns the maximum normal (base) power of the item. In armor this is the normal Protection. In weapons this is the normal Damage.
        Returns:
        The normal power

      • getCriticalChance

        public float getCriticalChance()
        Returns the chance of a critical hit. This is a float value from 0.0 to 1.0, with 1.0 as a 100% chance of a crit.
        Returns:
        The chance of getting a critical hit

      • getColor

        public Color getColor()
        Returns the color of the items name.
        Returns:
        The item name's color

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the name of the Quality. This is a human readable version.
        Returns:
        The quality name
